title.narrative: 1.4: ACCESS TO SAFE DRINKING WATER/WASHPACKAGE

description.narrative: Communities and families in priority regions,especially the most disadvantaged women and children, have increased goods and services for sustainable access to clean water and basic sanitation and adopt appropriate hygiene and environmental practices., which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young girls and boys (0â€“5 years), particularly the most deprived and hard-to-reach, are immunized, well nourished, healthy, protected, registered at birth and prepared for school, including in humanitarian situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and families in priority regions,especially the most disadvantaged women and children, have increased goods andservices for sustainable access to clean water and basic sanitation and adopt appropriate hygiene and environmental practices.

description.narrative: With UNICEF direct support, 94,051 additional people including 17,870 children under 5 have access to improved water sources in the regions of Gao, Menaka, Koulikoro, Sikasso and Kayes. 301,227 people including 158,117 women and 143,110 men are living in 247 newly open defecation free (ODF) certified communities and over 424,879 additional people in humanitarian situations have been provided access to safe water through emergency response.These results were achieved in partnership with the government and Regional Directorates of Hydraulics, Social Developmentand Solidarity Economy, and Civil Protection, as well as NGOs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
